body:
<!--
    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://js.foundation/community/code-of-conduct).

    1. To report a bug: https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/reporting-bugs
    2. To propose a new rule: https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/new-rules
    3. To request a change that is not a bug fix, rule change, or new rule: https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/changes
    4. If you have any questions, please stop by our chatroom: https://gitter.im/eslint/eslint

    Note that leaving sections blank will make it difficult for us to troubleshoot and we may have to close the issue.
-->

**What rule do you want to change?**

`use-isnan`

This rule targets `foo === NaN` ([Strict Equality Comparison](https://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/10.0/index.html#sec-strict-equality-comparison))

(also targets `!==`, `==` and `!=`)

Currently, the rule checks only `BinaryExpression` nodes, i.e. only explicit comparisons.

This is a proposal to also check the following:

* [CaseClauseIsSelected](https://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/10.0/index.html#sec-runtime-semantics-caseclauseisselected) internally performs Strict Equality Comparison, so `case NaN` will never match and it's a possible error.
* [Array.prototype.indexOf](https://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/10.0/index.html#sec-array.prototype.indexof) also uses Strict Equality Comparison, so `foo.indexOf(NaN)` will never match and it's a possible error. The same applies to [Array.prototype.lastIndexOf](https://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/10.0/index.html#sec-array.prototype.lastindexof).

**Does this change cause the rule to produce more or fewer warnings?**

More if an option is set to `true`. Defaults are `false`.

**How will the change be implemented? (New option, new default behavior, etc.)?**

2 options, `enforceForSwitchCase` and `enforceForIndexOf`.

**Please provide some example code that this change will affect:**

<!-- Put your code examples here -->
```js
/*eslint use-isnan: "error"*/

switch (foo) {
    case NaN:
        bar();
        break;
}

foo.indexOf(NaN);
foo.lastIndexOf(NaN);
```

**What does the rule currently do for this code?**

Nothing.

**What will the rule do after it's changed?**

```js
/*eslint use-isnan: ["error", {"enforceForSwitchCase": true}]*/

switch (foo) {
    case NaN: // error
        bar();
        break;
}
```

```js
/*eslint use-isnan: ["error", {"enforceForIndexOf": true}]*/

foo.indexOf(NaN); // error
foo.lastIndexOf(NaN); // error
```

**Are you willing to submit a pull request to implement this change?**

Yes. (there is PR #12106 for `enforceForSwitchCase`)
